name: Clin N Vagina
title: Clinical N
notes:
**Note 1:** Code only regional nodes and nodes, NOS, in this field.  Distant nodes are coded in distant metastasis.  For the lower third of vagina, iliac (common, external, internal (hypogastric), and NOS), and pelvic, NOS lymph nodes are coded in distant metastasis.  For the upper two thirds of vagina, inguinal and femoral lymph nodes are coded in distant metastasis.

**Note 2:**  When both the Federation Internationale de Gynecologie et d'Obstetrique (FIGO) stage and regional lymph node detail are available, record the code with regional lymph node detail in preference to a statement of FIGO stage. FIGO Stage III is assigned based on tumor extension and/or regional lymph node involvement.  Code regional lymph nodes based on a physician's statement of FIGO Stage III based on regional lymph node involvement or if the basis is not stated.

**Regional lymph nodes:**

    Upper two thirds of vagina, regional nodes: 
       Pelvic lymph nodes:
           Iliac, NOS:
              Common
              External
               Internal (hypogastric)
                   Obturator
                   Middle sacral (promontorial) (Gerota's node)
       Pelvic lymph node(s), NOS

    Lower third of vagina, regional nodes:
       Ipsilateral or bilateral:
          Inguinal, NOS:
             Superficial inguinal (femoral)
rows: Regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed

Clinical evaluation but unknown results or regional lymph node involvement not stated
Clinical evaluation done but results not documented in patient record

FIGO Stage III based on lymph node involvement
FIGO Stage III not stated if based on extension or lymph nodes

Regional lymph nodes, NOS
Lymph nodes, NOS

Stated as N1
Clinical N is not defined for the specific site/histology

No clinical evaluation of regional lymph nodes
Cancer first detected on surgical resection
Unknown if any clinical assessment performed
